intro: Parosela laxa, commonly known as the slender parosela, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that are typically white or pale pink, and its slender, climbing stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
